meanings.definition: Tending to giggle more frequently or easily than others.
meanings.sent1: She is the gigglier one in our group, always laughing at the smallest jokes.
meanings.sent2: The baby was gigglier than the adults at the party, finding joy in simple games.
meanings.sent3: Her gigglier nature made even the serious meeting a bit lighter and more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: His gigglier demeanor was like a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The gigglier atmosphere in the room was contagious, spreading smiles to everyone present.

meanings.definition: Comparatively more prone to giggling than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: Among the siblings, she was the gigglier one, always finding humor in everyday situations.
meanings.sent2: The puppy was gigglier than the older dog, wagging its tail at the slightest provocation.
meanings.sent3: The gigglier reaction of the audience made the comedian's job easier that night.
meanings.sent4: Her gigglier disposition was like a bright spark in a dull room.
meanings.sent5: The gigglier response from the children brightened up the teacher's day.
